title: Pak team participates in Int’l Olympiad in Informatics
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 06 (APP):The International Olympiad in Informatics (IOI) 2024 took place in Alexandria, Egypt, from September 1st to 8th, 2024, and for the first time, a team from Pakistan participated in this prestigious global competition being held in Alexandria, Egypt.
According to the official sources, teams from 96 countries competed, showcasing their talents in computer science and programming.
“We are proud to announce that the  Pakistani team comprising of Four students achieved an impressive result in their debut appearance, securing two bronze medals” they said.
The students who brought this honor to Pakistan are Mr. Muhammad Umair Ahmad Mirza and Mr Kaleem Raza Syed. Additionally, Mr Muhammad Saram received an Honorable Mention for his outstanding performance.
This remarkable success is a significant achievement for a country participating for the first time in such a high-level international programming competition.
Pakistan ranked 45th overall among the 96 competing nations—an encouraging result, especially considering it was the team’s inaugural participation in the IOI. We extend our heartfelt congratulations to all the students for their dedication and success in this competition.
We are confident that this achievement marks the beginning of even greater successes for Pakistan in future international contests, and we look forward to seeing continued progress and excellence from our young talent, they added.
